shared.tester

Class Comparison

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.tester.Comparison

  • public class Comparison
extends java.lang.Object
    An generic utility for comparing values in Instance objects
    Author:
    Jesse Rosalia

    • Method Detail

      • isAllCorrect

        public boolean isAllCorrect()
        Quick test to see if all parts of the instance are equal. See the comment above isCorrect for more information.
        Returns:

      • isCorrect

        public boolean isCorrect(int index)
        A generic comparison function. This should work for continuous, discrete and boolean output values, but will not make inferences for boolean or discrete values represented as continuous values (e.g. 0.8 will not be considered "1" or "true").
        Parameters:
        expected - The expected label or classification, stored in an Instance object.
        actual - The actual result returned from the classifier
        index -
        Returns:
        True if they are the same, false if they are different.

      • setEpsilon

        public void setEpsilon(double e)
        Adjust the epsilon used when comparing correctness. Values are considered "correct" if their delta is less than this value.
        Parameters:
        e -

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the size of the instances being compared.
        Returns:
